column2: 1.  Data on gilts in issue are updated after each gilt operation and when gilts redeem, as well as after the RPI has been published each month – the latter affects the size of the inflation uplift for index-linked gilts.2.  The index-linked uplift for each 3-month lag index-linked gilt is calculated using the index ratio for the business day following the report day.  For example, if the report provides data on gilts in issue on 16 August 2006 the index ratios used for the 3-month index-linked gilts are those pertaining to 17 August 2006.3.  The method used to calculate the uplifted value of "near maturity" index-linked gilts was changed in September 2008. Prior to then the inflation uplift for index-linked gilts that have had their final cash flow fixed was adjusted to always use the RPI value that fixes this final cash flow, resulting in an inflation uplift that remains constant for the last few months of a bond's life. Since September 2008 the DMO has calculated the inflation uplift for near maturity index-gilts in exactly the same way that it calculates the uplift for all other index-linked gilts.
